Class PlayingField

  • java.lang.Object
    • PlayingField

  • public class PlayingField
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages the moles and seats on screen to ensure that more than one Mole doesn't occupy a particular Seat at any given time. It is a mediator class between the Seat and Mole classes. It is responsible for generating the array of seats and moles and for updating their states.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayingField()
      Creates an array of Moles and a 2-dimensional array of Seats and then fills the moles array with Professor and Dean objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Mole getMole(int i) 
      Seat getSeat(int i, int j) 
      void killMole(Mole mole)
      This method removes the Mole passed in as a parameter from the current Seat it is at (which is recorded by the seat itself) by calling the Seat's emptySeat() method and then calls the Mole's kill() method.
      void updatePlayingField(long elapsedTime)
      This method updates all the moles in the PlayingField.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayingField

        public PlayingField()
        Creates an array of Moles and a 2-dimensional array of Seats and then fills the moles array with Professor and Dean objects. The constructor also places the moles at their initial locations (grid seating arrangement location, not world coordinate location).

    • Method Detail

      • updatePlayingField

        public void updatePlayingField(long elapsedTime)
        This method updates all the moles in the PlayingField. If a mole object is registered as dead, it is respawned by calling its makeAlive() method and placed back onto the field. All moles are updated here by calling their update() method.
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - the amount of time that has passed in milliseconds since the last iteration

      • killMole

        public void killMole(Mole mole)
        This method removes the Mole passed in as a parameter from the current Seat it is at (which is recorded by the seat itself) by calling the Seat's emptySeat() method and then calls the Mole's kill() method.
        Parameters:
        mole - the mole that is to be killed by the method
        See Also:
        Seat.emptySeat(), Mole.kill()

      • getSeat

        public Seat getSeat(int i,
                    int j)
        Parameters:
        i - the column of the seat that is being referred to
        j - the row of the seat that is being referred to
        Returns:
        returns the Seat at the specified location in this PlayingField, recall that the seats are arranged in a 2-dimensional array.

      • getMole

        public Mole getMole(int i)
        Parameters:
        i - the location of the mole in the array contained in PlayingField
